Historial:

SINFO XVIII - Recusou pois foram contactados muito em cima da hora.

SINFO XIX - Combinaram a vinda do Zenal Bava e um Stand no entanto o Zeinal Bava faltou e eles tiveram uma apresentação normal a borla, enquanto as outras empresas pagaram para fazer esse tipo de apresentação (estão colocados na blacklist da SINFO).

initial_post:
Viva,

Hoje falei com um contacto da CustoJusto (alumni da LEIC e antigo coordenador de um núcleo do CIIST), e ele disse que eles estão interessados em patrocinar a SINFO. Estavam já para este ano, mas parece que quando viram já foi tarde demais, e parece que normalmente têm um budget "generoso" para publicidade.
Eles estiveram hoje e estão amanhã no pavilhão de Civil, na JobShop que está actualmente a decorrer.
Como estão bastante interessados em estudantes de Engª Informática, e esta JobShop parece não estar a render muito (o interesse deles é LEIC/MEIC, e só lá têm aparecido praticamente MEEC e MEAero), falei com ele sobre um possível patrocínio (talvez gold!), e ele disse que estão interessados, apesar de haver sempre a incerteza do "pessoal de cima".

Para já:

contacts: pedro.bizarro@feedzai.com (Co-Founder and Chief Science Officer)
area: Área: Consultoria e Inovação; mais especófico: Big Data, Real-time Data Processing, Business Monitoring, Fraud Prevention, Large Scale Data Processing, Event Processing, Business Intelligence, Operational Intelligence, Hadoop Integration, Cassandra Integration, Analytics, Predictive Modeling, SaaS
description:
Descrição:
FeedZai creates software solutions that uncover and manage business anomalies in real-time so that companies can grow revenues from positive anomalies, and control costs and risks by managing negative anomalies. 

FeedZai’s fraud prevention application delivers the industry’s best sub-second fraud blocking with the lowest percent false positives. 

FeedZai’s business monitoring application delivers alerts that predict future anomalies in networks and applications for proactive control. 

Customers include Coca-Cola, Logica, Vodafone, Ericsson, SIBs Payment Solutions, Horizon Wind Energy, and Servebase Credit Card Solutions. 

FeedZai is headquartered in Redwood City, California.

area: Área: consultoria em usabilidade ("design, user research and programming" ou "Prestação de Serviços de Desenvolvimento de Software, Pesquisas de Mercado, Consultoria, Apoio Técnico, Marketing, Aplicações Web, Criação, Desenvolvimento e Manutenção de Websites")
description:
Descrição:
Webnographer is a technology company that believes that data can help businesses make better products. We help companies understand the data that drives their business, and help them to gain a greater understanding how their customers use their website. We do this by using the online tool that we have developed in-house to understand online user behaviour. 

Because our business is new and cutting edge, where you need to be a self-learner and self-starter, Webnographer participates in events in the design, user research and programming community; we often organise our conferences and events to encourage exchange of ideas

From the desktop client to the Web, this is a presentation about how we at Tecmic approached the evolution of one of our Public Transportation Management systems to the web platform, and how to recreate the tasks and purposes of our product, without losing its functionality.


Ricardo Ramos
Degree in IT Engineering from Instituto Superior Técnico in Lisbon, specialized in the field of Software and Web Development. He has carried out several projects for numerous road transport customers, governmental authorities and fleet operators both nationally and abroad. He was part of the Truewind – Chiron development unit and is currently a Web developer at Tecmic, involved in product design for the Web.

name: YDreams Robotics
initial_post:
YDreams Robotics



http://www.ydreamsrobotics.com/

YD Robotics (YDR) is guided by the vision of assuming a leading role in the rapidly emerging consumer robotics market, especially in the home robotic segment.
We believe that with currently available technology, intelligence can be added to everyday objects and appliances allowing for the introduction of new revolutionary products for the end-consumer. We foresee a future where robotic components will be pervasive – in appliances, consumer goods, transportation, and military, to name a few. This wide deployment will only be possible with low robotic component costs, high modularity, and reliable products.
